# A rabbit in a bowtie sipped champagne and ate croissants in business class,
and it'll make you feel bad about flying economy

By

[[Ben Mack](https://www.insider.com/author/ben-
mack)](https://www.businessinsider.sg/author/businessinsider)

\-

January 15, 2020

![Ogawa doesn't think she'll be bringing Coco on another
flight.](https://static.businessinsider.sg/2020/01/01/5e1f18d149878c4405602e34.jpg)

caption

    Ogawa doesn't think she'll be bringing Coco on another flight.
source

    Takako Ogawa

  * A bowtie-wearing rabbit named Coco flew on a business class flight from [San Francisco](https://www.insider.com/category/san-francisco) to [Japan](https://www.insider.com/category/japan) with her owner who was starting a new job there. 
  * "I couldn't leave her in the States, so I took her back with me," owner Takako Ogawa, co-founder and CEO of analytics startup [Panalyt Japan](https://www.panalyt.com/), told Insider. 
  * The flight was in late 2018, but the photos are just now going viral after appearing on websites like [ Metro](https://metro.co.uk/2020/01/14/bunny-travelling-first-class-gets-her-own-ice-cream-sundae-service-and-all-the-nuts-she-wants-12055039/) - which surprised Ogawa because she lives so far away. 
  * Ogawa added that Coco has flown before, too, and has also "gone to the Google office occasionally," where she used to work, been to barbecues, and also appeared in family portraits. 
  * As to whether Ogawa will be bringing Coco on a plane with her again, she told Insider: "I wish I could, but I think she's too old now that she's getting closer to nine years old!"
  * [Visit Insider's homepage for more stories.](https://www.insider.com/?hprecirc-bullet)

It's pretty rare to see a [rabbit](https://www.insider.com/category/animals)
in people clothes - and even rarer to see one sitting in business class on a
long flight. Yet that's exactly what happened in late 2018, when a rabbit
named Coco flew with owner Takako Ogawa from [San
Francisco](https://www.insider.com/category/san-francisco) to
[Japan](https://www.insider.com/category/japan). Now, the pictures are going
viral after appearing on sites like [
Metro](https://metro.co.uk/2020/01/14/bunny-travelling-first-class-gets-her-
own-ice-cream-sundae-service-and-all-the-nuts-she-wants-12055039/).

![Owner Takako Ogawa registered Coco as an emotional support
animal.](https://static.businessinsider.sg/2020/01/01/5e1f158b49878c5a48348182.jpg)

caption

    Owner Takako Ogawa registered Coco as an emotional support animal.
source

    Takako Ogawa

"I was returning to Japan, resigning from
[Google](https://www.insider.com/category/google) to start my new career,"
Ogawa, co-founder and CEO of analytics startup [Panalyt
Japan](https://www.panalyt.com/), tells Insider of taking Coco with her.

"I couldn't leave her in the [States](https://www.insider.com/category/usa),
so I took her back with me."

![Coco also enjoyed some nuts and champagne during the
flight.](https://static.businessinsider.sg/2020/01/01/5e1f169249878c43777f4f83.jpg)

caption

    Coco also enjoyed some nuts and champagne during the flight.
source

    Takako Ogawa

To bring Coco aboard, Ogawa registered her as an emotional support animal, and
paid $100 to have her in the cabin in a special case. When staff informed
Ogawa there would be no one sitting in the seat next to her in business class,
she decided to let Coco enjoy the high life.

"I thought it was super nice of the flight attendants to let her use the
unoccupied cubicle next to me, and for bringing her treats throughout the
trip," says Ogawa, adding staff would come by to meet Coco.

![Coco also traveled from Japan to San Francisco when they moved there in
2015.](https://static.businessinsider.sg/2020/01/01/5e1f170749878c5af5459202.jpg)

caption

    Coco also traveled from Japan to San Francisco when they moved there in 2015.
source

    Takako Ogawa

And Coco was a model passenger, too - Ogawa says that, although she brought
pet sheets in case of accidents, Coco didn't make a mess.

It's not the first time Coco has flown business class. "She traveled from
Japan to San Francisco when we moved there in 2015," explained Ogawa.

"This was her second long flight."

![Ogawa was surprised when she found out the story had gone
viral.](https://static.businessinsider.sg/2020/01/01/5e1f176949878c5b0f412642.jpg)

caption

    Ogawa was surprised when she found out the story had gone viral.
source

    Takako Ogawa

Ogawa said the story of Coco's flight going viral surprised her. "I didn't
know about it since I live so far away," she told Insider, adding it's
"adorable" that it has.

But will Ogawa be bringing Coco - who "has gone to the Google office
occasionally," been to barbeques, and also appeared in family portraits - on
board to live the high life in the sky again? She told Insider: "I think she's
too old now that she's getting closer to nine years old!"

![Coco the bunny eating a croissant and sipping champagne while in business
class on a flight from San Francisco to
Japan.](https://static.businessinsider.sg/2020/01/01/5e1f149d49878c59e4462432.jpg)

caption

    Coco the bunny eating a croissant and sipping champagne while in business class on a flight from San Francisco to Japan.
source

    Takako Ogawa

# Independent startup accelerator Accelerating Asia to close US$5m pre-seed VC
fund in July

[Garage](/garage)

# Independent startup accelerator Accelerating Asia to close US$5m pre-seed VC
fund in July

Wed, Jun 19, 2019 - 12:59 PM

[S
Priyashini](/authors/s-priyashini)[btnews@sph.com.sg](mailto:btnews@sph.com.sg)[](https://www.twitter.com/)

__3 -min read

__Listen to this article

Wed, Jun 19, 2019 - 12:59 PM

[S Priyashini]() [ btnews@sph.com.sg ](mailto:btnews@sph.com.sg)

__3 -min read

__Listen to this article

SINGAPORE-BASED Accelerating Asia (AA) is finalising the first close of its
pre-seed venture capital (VC) fund in July, where up to US$5 million raised
will be invested in over 40 high-growth startups in Asia, the independent
startup accelerator announced on Wednesday.

Investors in this fund comprise of angels, family offices and individual
investors. Further details have not been released.

The first group of startups participating in the accelerator programme
comprises mature startups specialising in Big Data, e-commerce, human
resources, logistics, software-as-a-service, transportation and remittances.
Their founders are from Asia, including Bangladesh, Malaysia, Indonesia,
Pakistan, Singapore, the Philippines and Vietnam.

Participating startups will receive S$100,000 in funding, an office space in
Downtown Singapore, and other perks from Amazon Web Services, Hubspot and
Tribe Theory. The pre-seed fund supports the investment in the form of a SAFE
(simple agreement for future equity) note.

The programme has two phases - Three months of weekly activities followed by a
one-month final period which includes a Startup Mastery Program in San
Francisco and Silicon Valley. Subsequently there is a Demo Day where founders
pitch their startups to investors, multinationals and government partners,
among others.

[

### See also

#### Startups can speed up growth with aid from Accelerating Asia

](/garage/startups-can-speed-up-growth-with-aid-from-accelerating-asia)

#### Get the latest on startups  
and business news

[Terms & conditions](https://sph.com.sg/legal/website_tnc.html)

Sign up

The first Demo Day of the programme will be on Oct 3 this year, and
applications for the next round of firms open in early October.

Accelerating Asia is supported by Enterprise Singapore.

"We are entrepreneurs ourselves and believe our experience and an extensive
network of best-in-class mentors, investors and partners put us in a unique
position to understand the pain points of our startups and play a part in
enabling their success," said Craig Dixon, co-founder, entrepreneur in
residence and program director at Accelerating Asia.

The 10 participating startups are:

Philippine firm BeamandGo that assists migrant workers with remittance;

Indonesia's Datanest, which employs artificial intelligence (AI) and machine
learning algorithms to help improve a company’s performance;

Pakistan's DeafTawk, which provides different online services to assist the
hearing-impaired;

Vietnamese medical startup, Medlink, which showcases a platform that connects
consumers, pharmacies and pharmaceutical companies to improve healthcare
accessibility;

Malaysia's Web2Ship, which helps online sellers to search, compare and book
different courier services by identifying the best shipping services.

Bangladesh's Loop focuses on creating a communication, payment, and data
infrastructure for shippers and carriers to address supply chain
transportation problems; whereas Zantrik is an automotive service and resource
platform that ensures seamless maintenance experience for vehicles, by
connecting service providers and applying quality assurance standards;

Singapore's Klaud9 matches photographers and brands to create photos for
clients' social media and marketing campaign; while Panalyt aims to provide
people analytics through user-friendly dashboards and AI-driven insights; and
TalentTribe is a recruitment platform that connects job-seekers with suitable
employers.

# This Pet Rabbit Got Her Own Seat in Business Class and Spent the Flight
Eating Croissants While Wearing a Bowtie (Video)

By [Ben Mack / BusinessInsider.com](/author/ben-mack-businessinsidercom)

January 17, 2020

[ Save ](javascript:void\(0\); "favorite share") [ Pin
](https://www.pinterest.com/pin/create/link/?url=https://www.travelandleisure.com/trip-

_This article was originally published
on[Insider.com.](https://www.insider.com/rabbit-business-class-flight-
photos-2020-1)_

It's pretty rare to see a [rabbit](https://www.insider.com/category/animals)
in people clothes -- and even rarer to see one sitting in business class on a
long flight. Yet that's exactly what happened in late 2018, when a rabbit
named Coco flew with owner Takako Ogawa from [San
Francisco](https://www.insider.com/category/san-francisco) to
[Japan](https://www.insider.com/category/japan). Now, the pictures are going
viral after appearing on sites like
[Metro](https://metro.co.uk/2020/01/14/bunny-travelling-first-class-gets-her-
own-ice-cream-sundae-service-and-all-the-nuts-she-wants-12055039/).

![Coco, the business class bunny, enjoys a snack of nuts and champagne on the
plane.](https://imagesvc.meredithcorp.io/v3/mm/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fstatic.onecms.io%2Fwp-
content%2Fuploads%2Fsites%2F28%2F2020%2F01%2Fbusiness-class-champagne-nuts-
bunny-BUNNYCLASS0120.jpg)

![](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20100%2067'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

[
](https://www.pinterest.com/pin/create/link/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.travelandleisure.com%2Ftrip-
ideas%2Fpet-friendly-travel%2Frabbit-business-class-flight-
photos%3Futm_source%3Dpinterest.com%26utm_medium%3Dsocial%26utm_campaign%3Dtravelleisure%26utm_content%3D20200408%26utm_term%3Dundefined&media=https%3A%2F%2Fimagesvc.meredithcorp.io%2Fv3%2Fmm%2Fimage%3Furl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fstatic.onecms.io%252Fwp-
content%252Fuploads%252Fsites%252F28%252F2020%252F01%252Fbusiness-class-
champagne-nuts-bunny-
BUNNYCLASS0120.jpg&description=This%20Pet%20Rabbit%20Got%20Her%20Own%20Seat%20in%20Business%20Class%20and%20Spent%20the%20Flight%20Eating%20Croissants%20While%20Wearing%20a%20Bowtie%20\(Video\)
"pinterest share") Image zoom

Takako Ogawa

**Related:** [Spotify Just Launched Specialized Playlists and Podcasts for
Pets](https://www.insider.com/spotify-will-make-algorithmically-curated-
playlists-just-for-your-pets-2020-1)

"I was returning to Japan, resigning from
[Google](https://www.insider.com/category/google) to start my new career,"
Ogawa, co-founder and CEO of analytics startup [Panalyt
Japan](https://www.panalyt.com/), tells Insider of taking Coco with her.

"I couldn't leave her in the [States](https://www.insider.com/category/usa),
so I took her back with me."

To bring Coco aboard, Ogawa registered her as an emotional support animal, and
paid $100 to have her in the cabin in a special case. When staff informed
Ogawa there would be no one sitting in the seat next to her in business class,
she decided to let Coco enjoy the high life.

"I thought it was super nice of the flight attendants to let her use the
unoccupied cubicle next to me, and for bringing her treats throughout the
trip," says Ogawa, adding staff would come by to meet Coco.

**Related:** [What It's Like to Travel on Flybe, the Budget Airline Used by
the Royals That's Fighting to Stay in
Business](https://www.insider.com/photos-flybe-flight-review-budget-airline-
prince-william-kate-middleton-2020-1)

And Coco was a model passenger, too -- Ogawa says that, although she brought
pet sheets in case of accidents, Coco didn't make a mess.

![Coco, the business class bunny, enjoys a the seat on the
plane.](https://imagesvc.meredithcorp.io/v3/mm/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fstatic.onecms.io%2Fwp-
content%2Fuploads%2Fsites%2F28%2F2020%2F01%2Fbusiness-class-bunny-seat-
BUNNYCLASS0120.jpg)

![](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20100%2067'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

[
](https://www.pinterest.com/pin/create/link/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.travelandleisure.com%2Ftrip-
ideas%2Fpet-friendly-travel%2Frabbit-business-class-flight-
photos%3Futm_source%3Dpinterest.com%26utm_medium%3Dsocial%26utm_campaign%3Dtravelleisure%26utm_content%3D20200408%26utm_term%3Dundefined&media=https%3A%2F%2Fimagesvc.meredithcorp.io%2Fv3%2Fmm%2Fimage%3Furl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fstatic.onecms.io%252Fwp-
content%252Fuploads%252Fsites%252F28%252F2020%252F01%252Fbusiness-class-bunny-
seat-
BUNNYCLASS0120.jpg&description=This%20Pet%20Rabbit%20Got%20Her%20Own%20Seat%20in%20Business%20Class%20and%20Spent%20the%20Flight%20Eating%20Croissants%20While%20Wearing%20a%20Bowtie%20\(Video\)
"pinterest share") Image zoom

Takako Ogawa

![Coco, the business class bunny, enjoys a croissant and champagne on the
plane.](https://imagesvc.meredithcorp.io/v3/mm/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fstatic.onecms.io%2Fwp-
content%2Fuploads%2Fsites%2F28%2F2020%2F01%2Fbusiness-class-morning-
croassaint-BUNNYCLASS0120.jpg)

![](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20100%2067'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

[
](https://www.pinterest.com/pin/create/link/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.travelandleisure.com%2Ftrip-
ideas%2Fpet-friendly-travel%2Frabbit-business-class-flight-
photos%3Futm_source%3Dpinterest.com%26utm_medium%3Dsocial%26utm_campaign%3Dtravelleisure%26utm_content%3D20200408%26utm_term%3Dundefined&media=https%3A%2F%2Fimagesvc.meredithcorp.io%2Fv3%2Fmm%2Fimage%3Furl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fstatic.onecms.io%252Fwp-
content%252Fuploads%252Fsites%252F28%252F2020%252F01%252Fbusiness-class-
morning-croassaint-
BUNNYCLASS0120.jpg&description=This%20Pet%20Rabbit%20Got%20Her%20Own%20Seat%20in%20Business%20Class%20and%20Spent%20the%20Flight%20Eating%20Croissants%20While%20Wearing%20a%20Bowtie%20\(Video\)
"pinterest share") Image zoom

Takako Ogawa

It's not the first time Coco has flown business class. "She traveled from
Japan to San Francisco when we moved there in 2015," explained Ogawa.

"This was her second long flight."

**Related:** [A Man in Nigeria Built His Wife a House That Looks Like a Giant
Plane Because She 'Loves to Travel'](https://www.insider.com/house-that-looks-
plane-nigeria-wife-loves-travel-2020-1)

Ogawa said the story of Coco's flight going viral surprised her. "I didn't
know about it since I live so far away," she told Insider, adding it's
"adorable" that it has.

![Coco, the bunny, with her
family.](https://imagesvc.meredithcorp.io/v3/mm/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fstatic.onecms.io%2Fwp-
content%2Fuploads%2Fsites%2F28%2F2020%2F01%2Ffamily-photo-bunny-coco-
BUNNYCLASS0120.jpg)

![](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20100%2067'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

[
](https://www.pinterest.com/pin/create/link/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.travelandleisure.com%2Ftrip-
ideas%2Fpet-friendly-travel%2Frabbit-business-class-flight-
photos%3Futm_source%3Dpinterest.com%26utm_medium%3Dsocial%26utm_campaign%3Dtravelleisure%26utm_content%3D20200408%26utm_term%3Dundefined&media=https%3A%2F%2Fimagesvc.meredithcorp.io%2Fv3%2Fmm%2Fimage%3Furl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fstatic.onecms.io%252Fwp-
content%252Fuploads%252Fsites%252F28%252F2020%252F01%252Ffamily-photo-bunny-
coco-
BUNNYCLASS0120.jpg&description=This%20Pet%20Rabbit%20Got%20Her%20Own%20Seat%20in%20Business%20Class%20and%20Spent%20the%20Flight%20Eating%20Croissants%20While%20Wearing%20a%20Bowtie%20\(Video\)
"pinterest share") Image zoom

Takako Ogawa

But will Ogawa be bringing Coco -- who "has gone to the Google office
occasionally," been to barbeques, and also appeared in family portraits -- on
board to live the high life in the sky again? She told Insider: "I think she's
too old now that she's getting closer to nine years old!"
